content.1: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
content.3: When his candle shined upon my head,
content.4: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God
content.6: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;
content.7: When I went out to the gate through the city,
content.8: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose,
content.9: The princes refrained talking, and laid
content.10: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
content.12: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and
content.13: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
content.14: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment
content.15: I was eyes to the blind, and feet
content.17: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.
content.18: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply
content.22: After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.
content.23: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide
content.25: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one
